abstract.para: The KLog Handbook aims to show all the features and how to use them.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: KLog is a hamradio logging program that intends to provide all the tools and features needed for the efficient and confortable management of the QSO / contacts in an amateur radio station.
KLog is the first multiplatform hamradio logging program that runs natively on Linux, Windows and OSX.
KLog is free software and the licence is the GPL V.3. You can find thehttp://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html.

section.title: Computer requirements
section.para: There are not many requirements to run KLog. You will need a normal computer/laptop running your preferred operating system of the list (Linux, Windows or OSX).
A Computer able to run the latest versions of Debian, Ubuntu, Windows or OSX will be more than enough of running KLog. Older computers may also work.
If you intend to download the sources, compile and install, you will need to pay an extra attention to the section.

section.title: Downloading KLog
section.para: You can download KLog from the KLog's download page in Savannah.
In the previousl link you will find the sources but also the binaries for Windows and OSX.
You can also download the binaries for Debian (linux) from https://packages.qa.debian.org/k/klog.html or https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/klog

chapter.title: Configuring KLog
chapter.para: This chapter will explain how to configure KLog

section.title: First execution and initial configuration
section.para: When you run KLog for the first time, there are some things that must be configured in order to be able to run. There are some simple steps to be done.

section.title: First execution
section.para: A wizard will guide you through the first execution process...
If your installation does not have any translation file, KLog will use English as a default language.
Just click OK to continue.
The wizard will show you another screen with a brief welcome to KLog. You will be able to skip that by clicking on Next.
Next step will b eto accept the license. As you probably know, KLog is free software and it is under the GNU General Public License. So, just agree to the terms of license and click on Next.
Now it will be time to download the DXCC information from the Internet. You can click on Download to download the latest information or on Ignore to continue without that information.

KLog will work without that information but the user experience will be degraded as KLog will not be able to tell you which DXCC entity are you contacting and will not be able to show many informations about your radio acivity.
Regardless you prefer to download or ignore, click on Next to continue.

section.title: Initial configuration
section.para: When the wizard has been completed, you will reach to the configuration dialog where you will be able to configure KLog.
In this section we will go to the mandatory settings that must be done in order to use KLog. All other settings will be explained in other sections of this handbook.
First thing to do is define your callsign and your locator.
This is important as KLog will use this information to calculate bearing and distances from your station.
You simply need to enter that information in the appropriate fields in the User Data tab.
KLog needs to have a log created in the database to be able to save your QSOs and will not be possible to continue without creating it.
You should go to the Logs tab and click on New to create a new log.

Once you click on New a new dialog will be open and you will need to enter, at least the callsign used over the air on the Station Callsign field. You will be able to continue accepting the rest of the default values.
Just click on OK when you are ready.
When you have created the log, you will be able to see it in the Logs tab.
Now, you have finished the basic configuration of KLog and you can click on OK to close the Configuration dialog and start

section.title: Mailing lists
section.para: There are two mailing lists about KLog.
The language of both mailing lists is English but in case of need we would create a mailing list in any language.
The main webpage to subscribe and manage your subscription to the mailing lists is the following: http://savannah.nongnu.org/mail/?group=klog.

section.title: Users mailing list
section.para: This mailing list is mainly to discuss about how to use KLog. Ask questions, provide answers, giving tips. The suggestion is that instead of asking the developers ask in this list so all the users can benefit of the knowledge.
You can subscribe and manage your subscription to this mailing list here: https://lists.nongnu.org/mailman/listinfo/klog-users.

section.title: Developers mailing list
section.para: If you decide to join the developers team, you are encouraged to join this mailing list. We will discuss all the decisions and problems about KLog's development in this list.

section.title: Reporting a bug
section.para: The best way to report a bug is to contact the development team throgh the mailing list.
Please provide all the information and procedure to repeat the bug.
Before you contact the development team, you should gather the information listed below.

listitem.para: The version of KLog you are using.
Which operating system you are using.
How can the developers reproduce/repeat the error on their computers.
If it is related with logfile, you may be requested to send the logfile.
Get some screenshots of the error or problem.

section.para: Don't worry if you don't know how to get that information, the development team will try to help you if it is needed.

section.title: Translating
section.para: Translations are always welcome by the KLog devlopment team. If you know how to read English and you feel confortable enough with a language that is not currently supported by KLog, please to offer your help to add a new language.
To add a new translation to KLog you need to create the klog_xx.ts being the xx the language code of your language.
The best tool tool to translate KLog into your language is QT Linguist. Please read the QT Linguist manual to learn how to use it.
